replies.body:
You sent a link where only you can see the list, because it's saved in your account.

My specs:
Intel i7-4770K running at 4GHz
GTX 970 + GTX 780 Ti (SLI doesn't work :/)
2x 8GB RAM
1x 256GB SSD, 1x 512GB SSD, 1x 2TB HDD, 1x 3TB HDD (almost 6TB in total)
Be Quiet 850W power supply
2x DVD drives

Keyboard: Roccat Isku FX
Mouse: Razer Deathadder Chroma
Headset: Logitech G933 Artemis Spectrum (It's wireless, can only recommend!)

I DONT WANT TO BRAG BUT I HAVE TOO :/

my absolute pcmasterrace powerhouse is a a6-3620 ($20 used)

8gb because its the sweet spot for maxing out games and I need the most i can get with that bad boy apu

1tb hdd because sdd's are overrated my pc boots up faster than you can say PCMASTERRACE

gaming mouse and mechanical keyboard (rgb) because i get 40 fps more when i use them

headset is a razer and turtle beach because i get 5 more fps also

replies.body:
I guess im the broke man out of all you guys I use an old HP Pavilion dv6...
I am not gonna try to find out its specs because it is no where near any of you fellas with a macbook and stuff..... lucky kiddos.

As for mouse I use either a Logitech G100s or a 2 dollar office mouse, I switch it up a bit sometimes.
Headphones------ 6 dollar earbuds
I also use this laptop cooler fan thing that connects to my laptop to prevent it from overheating so when im in TS not speaking and you hear something on my end, it is that.
I dont use a mousepad and my desk is a folding table

A crappy-ish computer. 

4gb RAM
500gb HDD
Intel Pentium 
Win10 64bit

No idea what the other specs are. It runs MC decently (30-50 fps) so that's all that really matters. Gets pretty laggy if you run multiple things at once though. This was my 'new pc' which was actually a downgrade from what I used in the past.

Acer Aspire 
6gb RAM
750gb HDD
Intel i3 (if I recall correctly)

replies.body:
PC:
NASA D-Wave Quantum Processor ($144,000)
Google & NVIDIA D-Wave Quantum Graphics Card (Double floating point precision; 56,000 CUDA cores) ($560,000)
Alienware Xtra Terrestrial 2PB HDD (16900 RPM) ($95,000)
Intel Quantum PCI-E SSD (256 TB) ($105,000)
NASA Pluto Watercooling Data Center with Google Nano-Steel cooling blocks. ($14,000)
Google Headquarters PC Case ($1.5 Billion)
NASA's Custom 35 Terawatt Power Supply ($44,000)

Accessories:
Apple Magic Keyboard
Apple Magic Mouse
Apple Magic Headset
Apple Magic Mousepad
Apple Magic Monitor
Apple Magic HDMI Cable
Apple Magic Hotdogs (Gamer food)

In total it came to be ~$55.4 billion (+ operation costs)

Benchmarks:
Minecraft (512x Resource Pack, SEUS Shaders): 1255 FPS
CS:GO (Ultra, 128x MSAA): 300 FPS
Adobe Premiere (30 Minute minecraft letsplay, Retina (5K), 120FPS): 2 seconds
